entry.title: Neural Modelling
entry.content:
About the dataset

https://www.cneuromod.ca/
https://www.cneuromod.ca/gallery/datasets/
https://docs.cneuromod.ca/en/latest/index.htm

PI
Lune Bellec

Funding
The Courtois NeuroMod project was made possible by a donation from the Courtois foundation. These funds are administered by the Fondation Institut Gériatrie Montréal (FIGM) at Centre de Recherche de l’institut Universitaire de Gériatrie de Montréal, part of CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’île-de-Montréal, as well as University of Montreal. The team has grown to include individuals from various institutions, and an up-to-date list of contributors can be found in the documentation.

Citations
Julie Boyle, Basile Pinsard, Valentina Borghesani, Francois Paugam, Elizabeth DuPre, and Lune Bellec. The courtois neuromod project: quality assessment of the initial data release (2020). In 2023 Conference on Cognitive Computational Neuroscience, pages 2023–1602, 2023.

St-Laurent, M., Pinsard, B., Contier, O., Seeliger, K., Borghesani, V., Boyle, J., … & Hebart, M. (2023). cneuromod-things: a large-scale fMRI dataset for task-and data-driven assessment of object representation and visual memory recognition in the human brain. Journal of Vision, 23(9), 5424-5424.

entry.title: Human Connectome Project - Young Adult
entry.content:
About the dataset

https://www.humanconnectome.org/study/hcp-young-adult
https://www.humanconnectome.org/study/hcp-young-adult/overview/

PI
Kamil Ugurbil (UMinn)
David Van Essen (WashU)

Funding
NIH Blueprint for Neuroscience Research

Citations

  1. Van Essen DC, Smith SM, Barch DM, Behrens TE, Yacoub E, Ugurbil K; WU-Minn HCP Consortium. The WU-Minn Human Connectome Project: an overview. Neuroimage. 2013 Oct 15;80:62-79. doi: 10.1016/j.neuroimage.2013.05.041. Epub 2013 May 25. PMID: 23702424; PMCID: PMC3724347.


CUBIC Path/cbica/projects/pennlinc_hcpya/data
Open Accessfalse
Sample Size1206
Number of Sessions1206
CuBIDSfalse
BABSYes (FAIRly big)
Average agerestricted data (range 22-35)
% Femalerestricted data
% Right Handedrestricted data



Data Access

The pennlinc_hcpya project on CUBIC is not open-access data. Access requires proof of ConnectomeDB registration and acceptance of the HCP open data terms (send email to Tien.Tong@PennMedicine.upenn.edu).

QSIRecon was run on the minimally preprocessed data, which were downloaded on the fly and removed upon completion of the QSIRecon job.

Rutherford B. Fett Fund

Citations
Pritschet L., Taylor C., Santander T., Jacobs E.G. (2021) Applying dense-sampling methods to reveal dynamic endocrine modulation of the nervous system. Current Opinions in Behavioral Science. Special Issue on Deep Imaging, edited by: Caterina Gratton and Rodrigo Braga.

entry.title: Get Support
entry.content:
If you have a question about working with AI2D data, please open an issue. The AI2D maintainers will be notified about the new post and will respond when they’re able.

If you have used AI2D data for your research, and would like to share a summary of your work as a blog post on the this website, please open an issue, and the AI2D maintainers will work with you to create the blog post.
